The Chapter on Unrestrained Freedom, with six miscellaneous essays
The Chapter on Unrestrained Freedom: Heaven and earth are equal in their functions.
All things are equal in their origination.
The sun and moon are equal in their brightness.
The four seasons are equal in their progression.
The way of continuous generation is the same.
However, what causes generation is not the same.
It is said that functions are not different.
It is said that origination is not varied.
It is said that brightness is not dual.
It is said that progression is not separate.
If all are allowed to naturally be as they are,
then people would be the same as tigers, wolves, and dragons.
Tigers, wolves, and dragons are fierce and aggressive by nature.
How can they be completely in accord with the natural goodness of heaven?
Therefore, it is said:
The Way is also natural.
What is not the Way is also natural.
The Way is also self-obtained.
What is not the Way is also self-obtained.
In the past, there were the Yellow Emperor,
Gao Xin,
Tang Yao,ğŸ”½Yu Shun,

If it is said, how can this be made clear?
As for the birth of the Yellow Emperor,
He cultivated virtue and wielded troops.
He governed the five qi and planted the five kinds.
He comforted the myriad people and brought peace to the world.
He went and ascended to the cloud-filled heavens.
As for the birth of Gao Xin,
He followed the principles of heaven.
He knew the urgency of the people.
He was benevolent and majestic, kind and trustworthy.
His appearance was luxuriant, his virtue was lofty.
His movements were timely, his attire was proper.
Having grasped the center, he pervaded the world.
As for the birth of Emperor Yao,
His benevolence was like heaven, his knowledge was like a god.
Approached like the sun, looked up to like the clouds.
Rich but not arrogant, noble but not indulgent.
He discussed with the common people and harmonized the myriad countries.
As for the birth of Emperor Shun,
His father was stubborn and his mother was foolish, but he was obedient and did not lose the way of a son.
At twenty, his filial piety was known.
In the end, he ascended the imperial throne and his bright virtue was in the world.

As for the birth of King Wen of the West,
He was deeply benevolent, respectful to the elderly, kind to the young, and courteous to those below him.
He reformed the harsh and oppressive government and resolved the disputes between Yu and Rui.
He received the clear mandate of heaven and became the ruler of the myriad countries.
As for the birth of Qi,
He observed the suitability of the land and became a farming teacher.

As for the life of a monk,
he inherits the legacy of Yao and Shun, and proclaims the teachings of Wen and Wu.

the Way of filial piety shines brightly.ğŸ”½As for the life of a recluse,
the ultimate righteousness becomes clear.

he is greatly upright.

he embraces utmost harmony.

he pursues evil deeds and harms the people.
He does not protect his own body and eventually lets go and dies.

and on land it is used to cut through tigers and rhinos.
Even if you try it out, it is vast and expansive.

Therefore, the sage entrusts the Way of nature,
but does not entrust the birth of nature.
He obtains the correctness of nature,
but does not obtain the perversity of nature.
Thus, he is still with Heaven and Earth,
but in motion he is different from birds and beasts.ğŸ”½Joy and anger cannot attack him,
and greed and cruelty cannot find a place in him.
He departs from all existences and establishes himself in the marvelous.
Therefore, the gentleman cannot but know the Way.
The Way is called the great wonder.
It is the utmost tranquility.
Yet it pervades all movements.
It is the utmost non-existence.
Yet it contains myriad existences.
It is vast and accommodating within sound.
Yet the wise cannot exhaust its tones.
It is brilliant within form.
Yet the enlightened cannot fully grasp its radiance.
It is called the unobtainable.
It ends with Heaven and Earth yet is never lost.
It is called the obtainable.
It fills Heaven and Earth yet has never existed.
Existence exists within non-existence, non-existence exists within existence.
Existence and non-existence are both forgotten, returning to the indescribable.
Therefore it is said, What is the utmost spirit of the world, who can be one with it?
Thus it can grasp Heaven and Earth and move the sun and moon.
Although Heaven, Earth, the sun, and moon are great,
how can they ever not be the function of the Way?
Nameless, it is the beginning of Heaven and Earth.
Named, it is the mother of myriad things.
This is what is meant.
There are people here.
They do not understand the Way, disheveled hair, and crazy behavior.
They say I am naturally chaotic within, and my eyes and ears run to external things.
They will cage my nature.
How can I be satisfied with life?
Humans have two great things.
Nature is great, and emotions are great.
Because nature is great, one can be the spirit of the birth of myriad things.
Because emotions are great, one can obstruct the mind of the sage.
When gold and wood rub against each other, they ignite.
The wood cannot withstand it and is burned.
When emotions and nature restrain each other, there is chaos.
Nature cannot withstand it and is destroyed.
Who knows.
If one's nature is complete.
Would not the common people become sages?
If one's emotions are complete.
Would not sages become common people?
Someone said.
The high gates and steep steps of Mingtang and Pigeon Tower are what the elders aspire to.ğŸ”½But when a bird passes over them, it flies quickly.

When a petty person passes over them, they chase the wind and leave.
Then birds and beasts are born in forests and thickets, and petty people are formed in the marshes.
Their divisions are fixed, and their natures cannot be changed.
These three go together.
Is it not so?
In this, it is said:
If the nature is complete, a common person can become a sage.
If the emotions are complete,
a sage can become a common person.
This has never existed in the world.
Xio Yao said:
Those who discuss great wisdom without waiting for the Yellow Emperor,
the great craftsman will be surpassed by the son of a woodcarver.

can speak of the Dao.
As for the son of Yu Yi Xi,
he was born with the same voice,
but grew up with different customs.

Because of Yi Ya's skill in cooking,
the father and son became suspicious and jealous of each other.

Zilu, that brave man,
was transformed by Confucius.
Thus he was able to promote righteousness.
Kui's skill in music was such that
when he struck stones and clapped his hands, the beasts all danced in unison.
When Zu Gong offered grass,
he said it three times in the morning and four times in the evening, and the people became angry.
When Hu Ba played the zither, the fish came out to listen.
When Bo Ya played the zither, the six horses raised their heads to eat.
Tai Jia and Qi Huan were those who roamed within the square.
They may have looked with their eyes and listened with their ears, but they may not have gone beyond the realm of things and events.
Their minds and emotions fought each other, and they were constantly preoccupied.
One day, they were transformed by others, and ritual propriety prevailed over them.
They were still able to abandon their mediocrity and aspire to be virtuous.
This is how it is with them and with birds and beasts.
From human emotions moving and pursuing things according to desire,
they are still able to be moved by pleasure and follow along in nurturing.
Are these nine not different beings created separately by the transformation of qi?
Why is this so? Beginning from this and ending with that,
beasts dwell while humans follow.
How much more so for the great throughway!
How much more so for the great totality!
Vast and silent, only the spirit, death and life do not transform.
How much more so for one who is not a human but a sage!
Therefore, Xun Qing said:
There is nothing greater than the transformation of the Way.
There is no greater blessing than having no misfortune.
But those who travel to different countries must know the way.
Those who travel a thousand miles must accumulate steps.
Going without knowing the road between Hu and Yue,
One would die without ever seeing a foreign country.
Departing without moving a step,
One would spend one's whole life without leaving the country's gate.
Therefore, the gentleman worries about not knowing the principles,
Not about his name not being beautiful.
He worries about not practicing the Way,
Not about his mind not being spiritual.
Let me try to discuss this.
The sage and the fool, the sage and the tyrant,
Their qi has differences but their nature is always the same.ğŸ”½Nature is not qi, and it does not exist.

In ancient times, having obtained the mother, one already knew the child.

Therefore, the interaction of yin and yang
Gives rise to the five phases.

To be a wise person.ğŸ”½To be a benevolent person.

The luxuriant qi of the five elements.

The great principle of the myriad things.

Xi Shan's Letter to Ziran Zi Xi Shan's Letter to Ziran Zi.
Ziran Zi is one who possesses the Way on Xi Shan.
He has lived in a humble place for thirty years.
He roams with old farmers and old gardeners.
He has never spoken of lofty matters even for a single day.
In the beginning of the Kangding era.
The imperial court sought Confucians in the wilds and marshes.
Those who knew him wanted to promote his Way to the Son of Heaven.
Ziran Zi led them away and did not look back.
I have a reason for this with Ziran Zi.
Hearing this, I was confused.
I said Ziran Zi is a wise man.
It is not appropriate not to see him.
I was about to part ways and could not speak with him.
Therefore, I wrote to admonish him, saying:
You, Ziran Zi.
You read books and explored the Way of Yao and Shun.
How can it be appropriate to be selfish and attain your own will?
Pushing it down to the people below and sharing it with the people.
Having no choice but to be in the mountains and forests.
In the past, Zeng Dian and Yan Yuan enjoyed the Way.
In the end, they remained hidden and did not change.
They did so because the Mandate of Heaven was greatly mistaken.
Now, the ruler of the world has the Way.
Naturally, your time is different.
How can you compare yourself to those two?
I have always said that there are three ways of being hidden.
There is heavenly concealment.
There is famous concealment.
There is physical concealment.
Physical concealment means secretly hiding deeply and not returning.
It is not what those who are arrogant to the world like.
Chang Ju and Jie Neng are such people.
Famous concealment means not observing governance and chaos, but floating and sinking with the times.
It is what those who follow official positions and preserve their lives like.
Yangzi Yun of the East is such a person.
Tian Yin, one whose mind is not stagnant or confined by events, has no fixed principles.
If it can be done, then do it. If it can be stopped, then stop it.
This is what those who understand change like.ğŸ”½Taigong Wang, Confucius, and Yan Yuan are such people.
Zi Ran Zi, your will is on Confucius.
But what you uphold is similar to Chang Ju, Jie Yu, and Jie Ni.
Those Chang Ju, Jie Yu, and Jie Ni, scheming and meticulous, only benefit themselves.
They do not have the heart to worry about the world.
They are not worthy.
Zi Ran Zi, you should think about this.
Is it better to have the Way in the mountains and forests, or to have the Way in the world?
Is it better to enjoy being with apes, deer, and elk, or to enjoy being with lords, ministers, and fathers and sons?
His aspirations are far-reaching, and his principles are great.
His name is illustrious.
It shakes heaven and earth, and illuminates the myriad generations.
Is it not glorious?
Zi Ran Zi, think about it.
Go now, do not stay with those who know words.
How could you consider my words to be crazy talk?
The Lament for the Butcher of Dragons, the Lament for the Butcher of Dragons, in ancient times there was a Zhu Pingman.
He was misled by his studies and ended up in a difficult situation at that time.
It is unknown where Zhu Pingman was from.
His nature was strong and healthy.
Cutting chickens and oxen was not enough to exhaust his bravery.
He thought of relying on an extraordinary butcher to suit his intelligence.
So he spent a thousand gold coins to study under a teacher.
After three years of study, he had nothing to use his skills for, and was despised by the world without anyone believing in him.
He happened to see butchers who slaughtered sheep and dogs in front of him.
The people in the market laughed at him when they saw him.
Alas, Zhu Pingman is gone.
After a thousand years, there are those who hear of him and feel moved by him.
And they write essays to express his story.
The dragon is the pure yang essence that is spiritual among scaled creatures.
It does not have a fixed form, but relies on the spiritual clouds and qi to transform and change unpredictably.
Therefore, in the human world, it is rarely seen.
They want to end its essence and strange phenomena, remove the violence from the rivers and seas,
eliminate its form and life, and make its kind disappear.
It is not possible to roam freely in the boundless.
Can a dragon be killed if one's wisdom meets with the divine?
I have heard of a country in the ocean.
Its people are like clouds.
Riding the wind and sun, they come and go beyond heaven and earth without a trace.
They then use dragon meat to support themselves.
This is the matter of those who kill dragons.
However, the matter of killing dragons was used in their country in ancient times.
Now, in the age of evaluation and wandering, it may be lost.
It is almost at rest.
The body and life of an evaluator and wanderer are different from those people.
But is it appropriate to be a dragon slayer?
However, evaluators and wanderers are not unaware that it is not their duty, right?
It is just that their nature and Dao are in accord, and their form and traces are forgotten outside.
How much less time do they have to consider the worldly uses and non-uses?
As for dragons, they are also spiritual creatures.
The art of butchering is difficult for people to master.
To evaluate and discuss this, one resolutely does it.
To exhaust and not stop, stopping or making it difficult, is the nature of evaluation and discussion.
Spiritual martial arts are wonderfully attained by the sage's bravery.
Alas, the way of butchering dragons is heard from the ancients.
Now for several generations, there has not been a single one who has seen the nature of evaluation and discussion.
Those who are called sages and worthies
are therefore able to exhaust human nature.
They exhaust the nature of all things.
Sages and worthies have not yet heard of distinguishing the mind of evaluation and discussion and rectifying its basis.
How much less can the petty worldly people
recognize evaluation and discussion?
Is the way of butchering dragons not exhausted?
Wandering in the six directions, ancient and yet present again.ğŸ”½The past can be pitied.
The future can be lamented.
Record of the Dragon's Roar, Record of the Dragon's Roar When I was nineteen years old,
I went to Ningfeng Township in my prefecture.
I arrived at the residence of the Daoist nun Yao.
The Daoist nun was an extraordinary woman.
Her residence was on Mount Jin.
I stayed there for several days.
I then heard a sound from the side of the mountain behind her residence, coming from the pond area.
It was as if a large bell was being struck.
This happened several times. I was initially puzzled.
This is not the sound of a bell.
After a while, I finally asked the Daoist nun about it.
The Daoist nun became solemn and said,
This is the dragon's roar.
Those who hear it are greatly blessed.
You will later certainly be good.
When the Daoist nun was a virgin,
she once went to fetch water from the stream.
Her body felt the dragon's mist.
On the evening when people paid homage to her, the dragon's light emitted from her room.
The girl then disappeared.
She disappeared but returned.
She no longer enjoyed living in her home.
The villagers revered her.
So he built a hermitage for her in the mountains.
However, since Yao NÃ¼ had been alone, pure, and vegetarian since she was young,
she was initially quite contrary to the Way, speaking of good and bad fortune in the human world.
Her words were often proven true.
By the time I saw her, she was already old.
Over sixty years old.
Her demeanor was serene, and she no longer spoke of the good and bad fortune of Daoists.
Wearing a paper hat and hemp clothes, she lived in a tall building, solely reciting Buddhist scriptures.
Even though there were tens of thousands of words, she would recite several scrolls day and night. She was kind to all beings.
Therefore, the people of her village were gradually converted by her.
I once asked her why she taught the scriptures.
She said that when she was young, there were always divine monks who would come riding through the air and teach her.
Therefore, I consider what she called the dragon's roar to be not false.
I have read many books and seen that ancient people were like this.
There were people like Fang Guan and Xue Lingzhi who lived in the mountains when they were poor.
They all said they had heard the dragon's roar.
Later, Fang indeed became a prime minister.
Xue Zhizhao was a prince's attendant reader.
This is the verification of what he heard.
Alas, although I am not comparable to the two gentlemen,
Nevertheless, I have already followed the Way and practiced it.
How can I be ungrateful to the sages and worthies, and yet be falsely slandered by ordinary people for promoting the Dharma, thus showing ugliness to the world?
How is it that what they heard is not different, yet the verifications are different?
What the Yao clan said can be doubted.
I think the dragon is a symbol of the ruler.
How is it that today the world is in peace and prosperity, with its reputation and cultural refinement,
That I can encounter the time and sing about it?
This is the verification.
Otherwise, the divine dragon also has false sounds to hear? There is a version that says the dragon also has false sounds.
Jiezi's understanding Jiezi's understanding is probably what the master was called when he was young, and later he was called Jiezi. Jiezi is a Buddhist practitioner.
Because of the profound and wonderful tranquility of the Way he has attained,

So he said to the two guests,
My delight in Confucianism
is simply because I find some agreement with my path in it.
What Confucians call benevolence, righteousness, propriety, wisdom, and trustworthiness are the same as what Buddhists call compassion and kindness,
giving,
respectfulness,
absence of self-conceit,
wisdom,
and not speaking falsely or frivolously.

to make people all good.

how can it be said that although they are good, it is not due to my teaching, and the reason they are good is that I am not good?

Now, the Confucian virtues of benevolence, righteousness, propriety, wisdom, and trustworthiness,
aren't they the myriad practices bestowed by my Buddha?

He also said,
The guest has no reason to rejoice in Confucianism, but only to temporarily take refuge in the Buddha's Dharma.
Although Jizi has no great talent, can he not serve as a gatekeeper, drummer, fish and salt inspector, or watchman?
Is it to accommodate one's body?
Sweetly falling into the shame and enduring what is loved.
The mouth does not dare to taste the pungent and bloody.
Those who serve the Buddha sincerely do so because its teachings are vast and its path is truly profound.
If one uses it to cultivate the body, then it is pure and clean fasting and precepts.
If one uses it to cultivate the mind, then it is upright, tranquil, and free from delusion.
If one extends it to others, then it is to reform evil and do good.
The good is to be sincere.
If one uses it for life and death and the beginning and end, then it is to communicate with ghosts and spirits and transform.
Even if one is hungry, emaciated, withered, and thrown into the grass and bushes, one cannot bear to move.
This is precisely because what they uphold is like this.
Even petty people in the market place, who rely on the market road for divination,
If there is one word that benefits what they are doing,
They are still able to carry the virtue of their teacher for the rest of their lives.
Although Zi is lowly,
Isn't he still more virtuous than the market people?
To obtain the way of being a person and yet be lucky,
To repay its teachings by being a slave,
People cannot bear to do it.
What about Ziji?

Guests, please do not take this as a discussion.

Guests, do not argue.
Confucianism and Buddhism are the teachings of the sages.

Buddhism is the great inactive aspect of the sage.

this is also a great lack of thought.

The two guests again debated the end of their teachings, and so on.

Now, each of you does not understand the basis of your teachings and yet debate the teachings you uphold.

The two guests stopped speaking.

he does not seek their power, does not serve the wealthy, and does not want their praise.
